intro: Phlox drummondii subsp. eudrummondii, commonly known as the showy phlox, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing a profusion of flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It prefers full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its botanical features include opposite, narrow leaves and a branching stem structure that supports its vibrant floral display.
